biogHist.p: Administrator, 1932-1996. Henry F. Ewasechko was born July 25, 1932 and graduated from high school in Golden Prairie, Saskatchewan. In 1965, he received his C.I.T.T. degree in Traffic Management from the University of Toronto. Mr. Ewasechko worked at a number of positions in the Canadian railway industry as well as being part owner of western supply stores in Medicine Hat and Lethbridge. In 1965, Mr. Ewasechko began working at the University of Alberta as an assistant systems analyst. Mr. Ewasechko was promoted to senior systems analyst in 1967 and became operations manager of the Computing Centre at the University of Alberta in 1970.
